storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate successful daily schedule display for authenticated employee
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for the current day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Employee schedules database is populated with test data
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page using a supported browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password) and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Authentication is successful and employee dashboard is displayed with navigation menu visible

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Schedule' section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens showing schedule view options

steps.action: Select 'Daily View' option from the schedule menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule for current day is displayed showing shift start time, end time, location, and role assignment. Current day is highlighted clearly

steps.action: Verify all shift details are accurate by comparing with expected schedule data
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shift information matches the employee's scheduled shifts including correct times, location, and role

steps.action: Click the refresh button or use browser refresh to reload the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view reloads successfully and displays the latest schedule updates without errors or data loss

steps.action: Verify the page load time is acceptable
steps.expectedResult: Schedule refresh completes within 2 seconds

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the portal
Daily schedule view remains accessible
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active for further navigation

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to own schedule only
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Multiple employee accounts exist in the system
Employee knows or can construct URL pattern for schedule access
Authorization and authentication mechanisms are enabled
Test employee has valid schedule data

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, note the current schedule URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL is visible and contains employee-specific identifier or session token

steps.action: Attempt to modify the URL to access another employee's schedule by changing employee ID or relevant parameter (e.g., change employeeId=123 to employeeId=456)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the modified URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this schedule' or HTTP 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data from the other employee is visible on the screen
steps.expectedResult: No unauthorized schedule information is displayed; only error message is shown

steps.action: Navigate back to the schedule section using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Navigation is successful and schedule menu is displayed

steps.action: Select daily view to access own schedule through normal navigation
steps.expectedResult: Employee's own daily schedule is displayed correctly with all shift details visible

steps.action: Verify all displayed information belongs to the logged-in employee
steps.expectedResult: Schedule shows only the authenticated employee's shifts with correct employee name and details

postconditions: Employee remains logged in with valid session
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
Employee can continue to access their own schedule
No data breach or unauthorized data exposure occurred

testCases.title: Test performance of daily schedule loading
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee has schedule data available for the current day
Network conditions are stable and normal
Performance monitoring tools are available (browser developer tools or stopwatch)
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor request timing
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and Network tab is active with timeline visible

steps.action: Clear browser cache and existing network logs to ensure accurate measurement
steps.expectedResult: Cache is cleared and network log is empty

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section menu is displayed

steps.action: Click on 'Daily View' option and start timing the page load
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule view begins loading and network requests are initiated

steps.action: Monitor the Network tab and note the time taken for the GET /api/schedules/daily API call to complete
steps.expectedResult: API request completes and returns schedule data

steps.action: Verify the total page load time from click to full schedule display
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule is fully loaded and displayed within 2 seconds. All shift details are visible and page is interactive

steps.action: Record the actual load time from the Network tab timing information
steps.expectedResult: Recorded time is at or below 2 seconds threshold

steps.action: Repeat the test by refreshing the daily schedule view 2 more times to verify consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: Each subsequent load also completes within 2 seconds, demonstrating consistent performance

postconditions: Performance metrics are documented
Daily schedule remains accessible and functional
Employee session remains active
System performance meets defined SLA of under 2 seconds

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

testCases.title: Validate weekly schedule display and navigation
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials and is authenticated
Employee has shifts scheduled across multiple weeks
Weekly schedule data includes both working days and off days
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains schedule data for current, previous, and next weeks

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page and enter valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens with available view options

steps.action: Select 'Weekly View' option from the schedule menu
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule for the current week is displayed showing all 7 days with shift details including start time, end time, location, and role for each scheduled shift

steps.action: Verify that all shifts for the current week are displayed accurately
steps.expectedResult: All scheduled shifts for the week are visible with complete and accurate information. Off days are clearly marked

steps.action: Verify that weekends and off days are highlighted or displayed distinctly from working days
steps.expectedResult: Weekends (Saturday and Sunday) and off days are visually distinguished using different colors, icons, or styling

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Week' navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view transitions to display the next week's schedule (7 days forward from current week)

steps.action: Verify that the next week's schedule displays correctly with all shifts and dates
steps.expectedResult: Next week's schedule is displayed with correct dates, all scheduled shifts, and off days. Week identifier or date range is updated

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Week' navigation button twice to go back to the week before the current week
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view navigates backward and displays the previous week's schedule (7 days before current week)

steps.action: Verify that the previous week's schedule displays correctly with historical shift data
steps.expectedResult: Previous week's schedule is displayed accurately with all shifts, dates, and off days. Historical data is preserved and correct

steps.action: Navigate back to the current week using the 'Next Week' button
steps.expectedResult: Current week's schedule is displayed again with all original information intact

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the portal
Weekly schedule view remains functional
Navigation state is preserved for continued use
No errors are logged during navigation

testCases.title: Verify access control for weekly schedule
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal as Employee A
Multiple employee accounts exist with different schedule data
Authorization mechanisms are properly configured
Employee A has valid weekly schedule data
Another employee (Employee B) exists with different schedule data

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, navigate to the weekly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's weekly schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Note the URL pattern in the browser address bar for the weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: URL is visible and contains employee-specific identifier or parameters

steps.action: Attempt to modify the URL to access Employee B's weekly schedule by changing the employee identifier in the URL (e.g., change employeeId=123 to employeeId=789)
steps.expectedResult: URL is modified in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the modified URL
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt and denies access

steps.action: Verify that an appropriate error message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Error message is shown indicating access denial (e.g., 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this schedule', 'Unauthorized Access', or HTTP 403 Forbidden error)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data from Employee B is visible on the screen
steps.expectedResult: No unauthorized employee schedule information is displayed. Only error message or access denied page is shown

steps.action: Use browser back button or navigate to schedule section again through the menu
steps.expectedResult: Navigation is successful and Employee A is returned to their own schedule view

steps.action: Verify that Employee A can still access their own weekly schedule normally
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's weekly schedule is displayed correctly with all shifts and off days visible

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with active session
Security event is logged for the unauthorized access attempt
Employee A retains access to their own schedule
No unauthorized data was exposed or accessed
System security integrity is maintained

testCases.title: Test weekly schedule loading performance
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee has weekly schedule data available
Network conditions are stable and normal
Performance monitoring tools are available (browser developer tools)
System is under normal operational load
Browser cache is cleared for accurate measurement

steps.action: Open browser developer tools (F12) and navigate to the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open with Network tab active and ready to record

steps.action: Clear browser cache and existing network activity logs
steps.expectedResult: Cache is cleared and network log is empty for fresh measurement

steps.action: From the employee dashboard, navigate to the Schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule menu is displayed with view options

steps.action: Click on 'Weekly View' option and simultaneously start monitoring the load time in the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule view begins loading and GET /api/schedules/weekly API request is initiated

steps.action: Monitor the Network tab and observe the API request completion time
steps.expectedResult: API request to GET /api/schedules/weekly completes and returns schedule data

steps.action: Wait for the weekly schedule to fully render on screen with all 7 days visible
steps.expectedResult: Complete weekly schedule is displayed with all shifts, off days, and weekends properly rendered

steps.action: Check the total page load time from the Network tab timing information (from initial click to DOMContentLoaded or Load event)
steps.expectedResult: Total load time is recorded and is at or below 3 seconds. Weekly schedule is fully interactive

steps.action: Record the actual load time and verify it meets the performance requirement
steps.expectedResult: Recorded time is within the 3-second threshold as specified in acceptance criteria

steps.action: Refresh the weekly schedule view and measure load time again
steps.expectedResult: Subsequent load also completes within 3 seconds, confirming consistent performance

steps.action: Navigate to next week and measure the load time for the new week's data
steps.expectedResult: Navigation to next week completes within 3 seconds with all schedule data displayed

postconditions: Performance metrics are documented and meet requirements
Weekly schedule remains accessible and functional
Employee session remains active
System performance meets defined SLA of under 3 seconds
No performance degradation is observed

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my monthly schedule to overview my work commitments

testCases.title: Validate monthly schedule calendar display and navigation
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has scheduled shifts assigned in the database
Employee portal application is accessible and running
Test data includes shifts in current, previous, and next months

steps.action: Navigate to the employee portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section is accessible and displays schedule view options

steps.action: Select the monthly schedule view option
steps.expectedResult: Monthly calendar is displayed showing the current month with all days visible, shift indicators appear on scheduled days, weekends and holidays are highlighted distinctly

steps.action: Click the next month navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to display the next month's schedule with correct shift indicators, month and year labels update accordingly

steps.action: Click the previous month navigation button or arrow twice
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to display the previous month's schedule (one month before current month) with correct shift indicators, month and year labels update accordingly

steps.action: Verify that weekends are visually distinct from weekdays
steps.expectedResult: Weekend days (Saturday and Sunday) are highlighted with different background color or styling

steps.action: Verify that company holidays are visually distinct
steps.expectedResult: Company holidays are marked with special indicators or different styling from regular days

postconditions: Employee remains logged in to the portal
Monthly schedule view is displayed
No data has been modified in the system
Navigation history is maintained

testCases.title: Verify access control for monthly schedule
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the portal
Employee B has scheduled shifts in the database
Authorization and authentication mechanisms are active

steps.action: Log in as Employee A with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and logged into the portal

steps.action: Navigate to the monthly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Employee A's monthly schedule is displayed correctly

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's monthly schedule by manipulating URL parameters or using direct API endpoint with Employee B's ID
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an appropriate error message such as 'Unauthorized access' or 'You do not have permission to view this schedule'

steps.action: Verify that Employee A's schedule view remains unchanged and only shows their own data
steps.expectedResult: Only Employee A's schedule data is visible, no data from Employee B is displayed

steps.action: Check system logs for unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security event is logged indicating unauthorized access attempt

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's schedule data remains secure and inaccessible to Employee A
Security logs contain record of access attempt
No unauthorized data exposure occurred

testCases.title: Test monthly schedule loading performance
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to quickly find relevant shifts

testCases.title: Validate shift type filtering in schedule views
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has multiple shifts assigned with different shift types (morning, evening, night)
Employee is logged into the portal
Schedule view (daily, weekly, or monthly) is accessible
Shift type filter options are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the employee portal and log in with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view is displayed showing all scheduled shifts with shift type filter options visible

steps.action: Verify that shift type filter dropdown or options are available
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter control is visible with options such as 'Morning', 'Evening', 'Night', or other configured shift types

steps.action: Note the total number of shifts displayed before applying any filter
steps.expectedResult: All shifts across all shift types are visible in the schedule view

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view updates dynamically to display only morning shifts, other shift types are hidden, shift count decreases to show only morning shifts

steps.action: Verify that only morning shifts are displayed in the filtered view
steps.expectedResult: All visible shifts are confirmed to be morning shift type, no evening or night shifts are shown

steps.action: Change the filter selection to 'Evening' shift type
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view updates to display only evening shifts, morning shifts are no longer visible

steps.action: Verify that only evening shifts are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All visible shifts are confirmed to be evening shift type

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filter' button or select 'All shifts' option
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view updates to display all shifts regardless of shift type, total shift count matches the original unfiltered count

steps.action: Verify that all shift types are now visible in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Morning, evening, and night shifts are all displayed, filter is successfully cleared

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule view displays all shifts with filter cleared
Filter functionality is ready for subsequent use
No data has been modified

testCases.title: Test performance of filtered schedule retrieval
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has a large dataset of shifts (minimum 50 shifts) with various shift types
Employee is logged into the portal
Performance monitoring tools are available
Network connection is stable
Browser cache is cleared

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies
steps.expectedResult: Browser cache is successfully cleared

steps.action: Log in to the employee portal with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view is displayed with all shifts visible

steps.action: Start performance timer and select a shift type filter (e.g., 'Morning')
steps.expectedResult: Filter selection is registered and filtering process begins

steps.action: Measure the time from applying the filter until the filtered schedule is completely rendered and interactive
steps.expectedResult: Filtered schedule loads and displays within 2 seconds, only selected shift type is shown, schedule is fully interactive

steps.action: Record the actual load time for the filtered results
steps.expectedResult: Load time is documented and is less than or equal to 2 seconds

steps.action: Apply a different shift type filter (e.g., 'Evening') and measure performance again
steps.expectedResult: Second filter application also completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Clear the filter and measure the time to return to unfiltered view
steps.expectedResult: Clearing filter and displaying all shifts completes within 2 seconds

postconditions: Filtered schedule is fully loaded and functional
Performance metrics are recorded and meet the 2-second requirement
Employee remains logged in
Schedule view is ready for further interactions

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to refresh my schedule view to see the latest updates

testCases.title: Validate schedule refresh updates data correctly
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has navigated to the schedule view
Schedule data exists in the database
Network connection is stable
Backend API is operational

steps.action: Verify that the refresh button is visible in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Refresh button is displayed and enabled in the schedule view interface

steps.action: Note the current schedule data displayed (shifts, times, dates)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule data is visible and documented for comparison

steps.action: Click the refresh button in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator appears and refresh process initiates

steps.action: Observe the schedule view during refresh
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates with latest data within 2 seconds without full page reload

steps.action: Verify that the system displays a confirmation message
steps.expectedResult: Success notification message is displayed confirming schedule has been refreshed

steps.action: Compare the refreshed schedule data with the previously noted data
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays the most current data from the database, reflecting any recent changes

postconditions: Schedule view displays the latest data from the database
Success confirmation message is visible to the user
Employee remains logged in and authenticated
UI is responsive and ready for further interactions

testCases.title: Test refresh failure handling
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has navigated to the schedule view
Test environment allows simulation of backend failures
Ability to disconnect or simulate API failure is available

steps.action: Verify that the refresh button is visible in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Refresh button is displayed and enabled in the schedule view interface

steps.action: Simulate a backend failure (disconnect API, stop backend service, or use mock failure response)
steps.expectedResult: Backend is unavailable or configured to return error response

steps.action: Click the refresh button in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Refresh request is initiated and attempts to fetch data from backend

steps.action: Observe the system response to the failed refresh attempt
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed to the user indicating refresh failed

steps.action: Verify that the UI remains stable and functional
steps.expectedResult: UI does not crash, freeze, or become unresponsive; previous schedule data remains visible

steps.action: Verify that the error message is user-friendly and informative
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly communicates the failure and suggests possible actions (e.g., 'Unable to refresh schedule. Please try again later.')

steps.action: Restore backend connectivity and click refresh button again
steps.expectedResult: Schedule refreshes successfully and displays updated data with success confirmation

postconditions: UI remains stable without crashes or errors
Employee remains logged in and authenticated
Previous schedule data is still visible if refresh fails
System is ready to retry refresh operation when backend is restored
